Katsune Donkatsu Caf√© 

Jan 16, 2020

Katsune Donkatsu Caf√© is a modest counter-serve caf√© setting decorated only by picnic-patterned tables. Katsu is a popular Japanese/Korean deep fried panko breaded meat cutlet served with ‚ÄúBull Dog‚Äù tonkatsu sauce, a Japanese sauce sweetened with fruit and vegetables.

Katsune is one of the few Bergen County restaurants totally dedicated to katsu-style dishes, and they‚Äôve mastered it. The restaurant has lengthier and flatter panko breadcrumbs that make their katsu flakier than all.

The caf√© serves up the standard pork donkatsu, as well as the famous cheese ‚ÄúCordon Bleu‚Äù donkatsu (pork - pictured below), chicken, ebi (shrimp), beef and pork patty (menchi) katsu dishes. They also serve up a ‚ÄúWang Donkatsu‚Äù, a much larger, even crispier, pounded flat donkatsu. A side of made-in-house curry can be added to all dishes too.

Their cheese donkatsu comes with a generous stuffing of mozzarella cheese that makes for the picture-perfect cheese pull. Katsune also keeps their pork tenderloin so juicy after frying, something that‚Äôs difficult to accomplish in deep-fried meat dishes.

Pork Cordon Bleu (Cheese Donkatsu)

All dishes are served with a side of steamed white rice, corn, Japanese-style coleslaw, and soy sauce pickles. They are also accompanied by the standard ‚ÄúBull Dog‚Äù tonkatsu sauce, as well as a homemade banana sauce that‚Äôs surprisingly addictive.

The unassuming exterior of the restaurant might not bring you in right away, but the flakiest katsu in Bergen County (maybe even in the NYC area‚Ä¶) makes this a place you‚Äôll regret not eating at. Katsune Donkatsu for the win!

See you soon,
